Article.ArticleTitle: Absolute cross sections of ozone at atmospheric temperatures for the Wulf and the Chappuis bands.

AbstractText: Ozone absorption constitutes a variable background against which measurement of pollution is observed from satellites by the solar occultation technique. The temperature-altitude gradient of ozone spans the range 180-340 K. Laboratory measurements of ozone absorption at temperatures across this range are needed to calibrate spectroscopic remote sensing, but have yielded results in substantial disagreement with each other. This paper presents the first measurements of the variation of absorption cross-sections of ozone at temperatures from 144 to 300 K over the 9250-18 500 cm(-1) spectral region.
